Name: Appropriation of funds for the operation and maintenance of the library systems.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to appropriation of funds for the operation and maintenance of the library systems

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance

Summary: This local law would state that in any given fiscal year, upon agreement by the Mayor and the Council, 2.5 percent of the City’s real property tax revenue would be appropriated to the City’s three library systems for their operation and maintenance.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows: 
 
      Section 1.  Section 5-509 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision 7 to read as follows:
      7.  Upon agreement between the mayor and the council, a sum representing two and one-half percent of the real property tax revenue assessed each fiscal year shall be appropriated to the operation and maintenance of the library systems.
      � 2. This law takes effect immediately.
